Description: Foot and bowl sherd of Attic red figure pottery cup-skyphos with heavy ring foot; interior glazed black; exterior: glazed black with possibly part of ornament band under scene; reserved band lower down on bowl; no relief lines; outside of foot (groove near top with trace of red or brown), resting surface and underside reserved; inside of foot black with incised graffito.
Curator's comments: Compare the inscription 'Archedike kale' on the Red Figure lekythos by the Sabouroff Painter, c. 450 BC, NY MM 25.60.78.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (pl. 5, no. 108)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 704, no. 631)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0726) (Phase 1)
